intro: Corydalis tibetoalpina, commonly known as the Tibetan poppy, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas and other mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, nodding flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The plant has slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal medicine.
